result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant wants time to think about it.  He will contact DA.  STC set for 1/4/16 at 3 pm.

same appearances.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  He understood.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered NGP on behalf of the defendant.  PTC 11/25  STC 12/14.
Court reviewed with the defendant.  He understood the form and it's contents.  Court found that the defendant freely and voluntarily waived his right to Attorney.

denied. Defendant not eligible for court appointed attorney.

SPD Eligibility Worksheet - not eligible
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-19-2015 09:30 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant has not contacted SPD yet.  He will contact them.  AIA set for 10/19/15 at 9:30 pm.  Defendant told to contact SPD today.  Other options explained.  Address correct.

This bond covers cases 15CT47 and 15CM145:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Court questioned defendant on his failure to appear on 7/20.  Defendant forgot.  Court advised defendant to contact SPD.  Other options explained.  Bond set.  AIA set for 10/5/15 at 9:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-05-2015 09:30 am
